'John Edward Gray', FRS (12 February 1800 – 7 March 1875) was a British
zoologist. He was the elder brother of George Robert Gray and son of the
pharmacologist and botanist Samuel Frederick Gray (1766â1828).

Gray was Keeper of Zoology at the British Museum in London from 1840 until
Christmas 1874, before the Natural History holdings were split off to the
Natural History Museum. He published several catalogues of the museum
collections that included comprehensive discussions of animal groups as well as
descriptions of new species. He improved the zoological collections to make them
amongst the best in the world.
